thread.title: Radio Waves: Music Choice is playing non-stop Halloween tunes this month
thread.title_full: Radio Waves: Music Choice is playing non-stop Halloween tunes this month

title: Radio Waves: Music Choice is playing non-stop Halloween tunes this month
text:
Pages: 1 2 > display on one page 
Cable television's Music Choice is playing non-stop Halloween tunes on its "Sounds of the Seasons" channel through Nov. 1. 
The channel is the ideal complement for seasonal activities such as pumpkin carving, haunted houses and costume parties. 
Tune in to hear the most popular Halloween tunes, including "Monster Mash," Bobby "Boris" Pickett; "Witch Doctor," Sha-Na-Na version; and "Over at Frankenstein's Place," Rocky Horror Picture Show. 
Additionally, Music Choice On Demand will have a special Halloween-themed video playlist titled "Halloween Hits" from Monday to Nov. 1. 
Videos featured in the playlists will be a medley of Halloween videos, including "Thriller," Michael Jackson; "Disturbia," Rihanna; "Paranoid," Ty Dolla $ign; "Wall to Wall," Chris Brown; "Sweet Dreams," Marilyn Manson; "Somebody's Watching Me," Rockwell; "Bad Blood," Bastille; and "Dragula," Rob Zombie. Information: musicchoice.com. 
* 
WABC-AM (770) has appointed veteran voice talent and creative audio production professional Christopher Libertini as staff announcer and production director. 
Libertini, who attended Manalapan High School in Englishtown, steps into the role formerly held by radio icon Johnny Donovan, who retired in May after 43 years at WABC. 
Libertini has worked for some of the biggest brands in media and entertainment over the past 15 years, and created signature sounds for Howard Stern, NFL Radio, SiriusXM, ESPN, MLB and CBS Radio. He also worked at WKXW-FM (101.5), Trenton. 
Currently, Libertini's voice can be heard on Cartoon Network, The Biography Channel, New York Lottery ads and various documentaries. 
* 
SiriusXM and the National Football League have signed a six-year extension of their satellite broadcasting and marketing agreement. 
The satcaster, the official satellite radio partner of the NFL since 2004, will continue to feature every NFL game live nationwide from the preseason through Super Bowl LVI in 2022, as well as SiriusXM NFL Radio, SiriusXM's 24/7 radio channel dedicated entirely to the NFL. 
SiriusXM also airs multiple Spanish-language NFL broadcasts each week of the season. 
* 
Centenary College of Hackettstown and Philadelphia public radio station WXPN-FM (88.5), owned by the University of Pennsylvania, jointly announced a sales agreement and transfer of ownership for the broadcasting license of WNTI-FM (91.9), the public radio station owned by Centenary College, to WXPN. 
WXPN produces many NPR programs — including "World Café," which was heard on WNTI twice daily and will remain part of its music programming. 
Sale price is $1.25 million in cash and another $500,000 in underwriting value over 10 years. 
FCC approval of the transaction is expected to take 60 to 90 days after the filing. 
* 
WPLJ-FM (95.5) is teaming with Manhattan's Angelo David Salon from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. today to present "Blow Out Breast Cancer," a benefit for breast cancer research and a celebration of survivors and fighters. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
